reason:
CRITICAL DEPENDENCY ON MULTIPLY-CHALLENGED NODES 1.3.1 AND 1.3.2: ALL DYNAMICAL CLAIMS COLLAPSE.

The node makes two dynamical claims about the BLM model:
(A) "[Vol_hyp(q)] controls the relative weight of non-melonic Feynman diagrams"
(B) "[Vol_hyp(q)] controls the breakdown of the 1/j perturbative expansion"

Both claims depend logically on:
- Node 1.3.1 (exponential 6j asymptotics at fixed real q): which has 4 OPEN CRITICAL/MAJOR challenges, including: (i) all three cited references are for roots of unity, not fixed real q (ch-a2f4e81cca5); (ii) the q <-> q^{-1} symmetry contradicts the claimed sign dichotomy for Vol_hyp (ch-3b488dcc873); (iii) Vol_hyp(Delta(q,j_i)) is not even DEFINED for fixed real q (ch-7ff9d4b9c61).
- Node 1.3.2 (melonic dominance breakdown): which has 7 OPEN challenges, including: (i) the exponential rate formula Vol_hyp - 2 log q is INCORRECT under any consistent treatment of vertex normalizations (ch-1c5e418a957, ch-b6e696489f6); (ii) the tetrahedron diagram does not even appear in the BLM model (ch-728b641d0b9); (iii) critical dependency on unproven node 1.3.1 (ch-a62f63a13e2).

Node 1.3.4 does not declare ANY dependencies on 1.3.1 or 1.3.2, yet its dynamical claims are logically vacuous without them. Without established exponential 6j asymptotics (1.3.1) and a correct diagram scaling analysis (1.3.2), the statements about "controlling relative weight" and "breakdown of perturbative expansion" have no mathematical content. The node must either: (i) declare these dependencies explicitly (which would propagate taint from the multiply-challenged siblings), or (ii) provide independent justification for its dynamical claims.
